items.title: In Minnesota, ‘dairy princesses’ take home a 90-pound butter bust of their own heads
items.description: They can deep-freeze their heads as souvenirs or share them with family and friends.

items.title: Trump declares war on clean energy. The numbers show it’s the only thing keeping America’s lights affordable
items.description: The “scam of the century,” according to Trump, is the only thing keeping bills from soaring.

items.title: I’m the president of a $1 billion software unicorn and I’ve seen the ‘Gen Z stare’ disappear in healthy workplaces. It’s a wake-up call for hospitality
items.description: That so-called stare isn’t a withdrawal; it’s a mirror.

items.title: China’s economic data is famously unreliable—and could be a warning if Trump meddles with the Bureau of Labor Statistics
items.description: Beijing “is really intolerant of economic instability, and so everything gets smoothed,” Derek Scissors of the American Enterprise Institute says.

items.title: Philadelphia’s famously spooky Mutter Museum redraws policies around displaying its 6,500 human remains
items.description: The museum's new human remains policy says that many were “obtained in unacceptable circumstances including through force or duress."
